maml:description.maml:para: Disables the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell event provider logs.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet disables the Operational and Analytic event logs of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell event provider.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
When this parameter is used, the cmdlet disables the Analytic event log of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell provider. The Operational event log is not changed.
When this parameter is used, the cmdlet disables the Analytic event log of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell provider. The Operational event log is not changed.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet uses the `Get-LogProperties` and `Set-LogProperties` cmdlets.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 1: Disable the Analytic event log for PowerShell ---

maml:description.maml:para: Stop the logging session started by Enable-PSWSManCombinedTrace.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet stops the logging session started by `Enable-PSWSManCombinedTrace`.
This cmdlet uses the `Stop-Trace` cmdlet.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Disable the combined logging session -------

maml:description.maml:para: Stop the WSMan logging session started by Enable-WSManTrace.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet stops the WSMan logging session started by Enable-WSManTrace.
This cmdlet uses the `Stop-Trace` cmdlet.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
Enables the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell event provider logs.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet enables the Operational and Analytic event logs of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell event provider.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
When this parameter is used, the cmdlet enables the Analytic event log of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell provider. The Operational event log is not changed.
Used to force the change without prompting.
When this parameter is used, the cmdlet enables the Analytic event log of the Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell provider. The Operational event log is not changed.
Used to force the change without prompting.

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet uses the `Get-LogProperties` and `Set-LogProperties` cmdlets.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: --- Example 1: Enable the Analytic event log for PowerShell ---

maml:description.maml:para: Start a logging session with the WSMan and PowerShell providers enabled.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet starts a logging session with the following PowerShell providers enabled:
- Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell
- Microsoft-Windows-WinRM
The session is named 'PSTrace'.
This cmdlet uses the `Start-Trace` cmdlet.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
By default, the events are written to "$pshome\Traces\PSTrace.etl". When this parameter is used, the cmdlet creates a unique filename: "$pshome\Traces\PSTrace_{guid}.etl"
By default, the events are written to "$pshome\Traces\PSTrace.etl". When this parameter is used, the cmdlet creates a unique filename: "$pshome\Traces\PSTrace_{guid}.etl"

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1: Start a combined logging session ---------

maml:description.maml:para: Start a logging session with the WSMan providers enabled.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet starts a logging session with the WSMan providers enabled. The following event providers are enabled:
- Event Forwarding
- IpmiDrv
- IPMIPrv
- WinRM
- WinrsCmd
- WinrsExe
- WinrsMgr
- WSManProvHost
The session is named 'wsmlog'.
This cmdlet uses the `Start-Trace` cmdlet.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- Example 1: Start a WSMan logging session. ----------

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the properties of a Windows event log.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet gets the configuration settings of a Windows event log. This cmdlet is used by the `Enable-PSTrace` and `Disable-PSTrace` cmdlets.
The name of the event provider.
The name of the event provider.
The PSDiagnostics module adds the LogDetails class to the `Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics` namespace.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the configuration settings of the Windows PowerShell event log
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LogProperties 'Windows PowerShell'
Name : Windows PowerShell Enabled : True Type : Admin Retention : False AutoBackup : False MaxLogSize : 15728640

maml:description.maml:para: Changes the properties of a Windows event log.

> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet changes the configuration settings of a Windows event log. This cmdlet is used by the `Enable-PSTrace` and `Disable-PSTrace` cmdlets.
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
The updated configuration settings to be assigned to the event log.
Used to force the change without prompting.
Used to force the change without prompting.
The updated configuration settings to be assigned to the event log.
You must pass a fully configured LogDetails object to the `Set-LogProperties` cmdlet. Therefore, to change one setting, you should use `Get-LogProperties` to retrieve the current configuration.

maml:alert.maml:para: You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Change the retention setting of the Windows PowerShell event log
command:example.dev:code:
$logDetails = Get-LogProperties 'Windows PowerShell' $logDetails.Retention = $True Set-LogProperties -LogDetails $logDetails Get-LogProperties 'Windows PowerShell'
Name : Windows PowerShell Enabled : True Type : Admin Retention : True AutoBackup : False MaxLogSize : 15728640

maml:description.maml:para: Start an Event Trace logging session.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet starts a Windows Event Trace logging session.
This cmdlet is used by the following cmdlets:
- `Enable-PSWSManCombinedTrace`
- `Enable-WSManTrace`
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
The name of the Event Trace session. To stop a trace session you must know the session name.
Path of the output log file or the DSN and log set name in a SQL database. The default path is `$env:systemdrive\PerfLogs\Admin`.
File listing multiple Event Trace providers to enable.
Event Trace Session buffer size in kilobytes (KB).
Send commands to Event Trace Sessions directly without saving or scheduling.

Specifies the log format for the data collector. For SQL database format, you must use the OutputFilePath option in the command line with the `dsn!log` value. The default is binary (bin). The possible values are:
- bin - binary
- bincirc - binary with circular logging
- csv - Comma-separated values
- tsv - Tab-separated values
- sql - SQL database
Sets the maximum number of Event Trace Session buffers.
Sets the maximum log file size in megabytes (MB) or number of records for SQL logs.
Sets the minimum number of Event Trace Session buffers.
Event Trace Session buffer size in kilobytes (KB).
Send commands to Event Trace Sessions directly without saving or scheduling.

Specifies the log format for the data collector. For SQL database format, you must use the OutputFilePath option in the command line with the `dsn!log` value. The default is binary (bin). The possible values are:
- bin - binary
- bincirc - binary with circular logging
- csv - Comma-separated values
- tsv - Tab-separated values
- sql - SQL database
Sets the maximum number of Event Trace Session buffers.
Sets the maximum log file size in megabytes (MB) or number of records for SQL logs.
Sets the minimum number of Event Trace Session buffers.
Path of the output log file or the DSN and log set name in a SQL database. The default path is `$env:systemdrive\PerfLogs\Admin`.
File listing multiple Event Trace providers to enable.
The name of the Event Trace session. To stop a trace session you must know the session name.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Start a WSMan Trace logging session --------

maml:description.maml:para: Stop an Event Trace logging session.
> This cmdlet is only available on the Windows platform. This cmdlet stops a Windows Event Trace logging session.
This cmdlet is used by the following cmdlets:
- `Disable-PSWSManCombinedTrace`
- `Disable-WSManTrace`
You must run this cmdlet from an elevated PowerShell session.
The name of the Event Trace session to be stopped.
Send commands to Event Trace Sessions directly without saving or scheduling.
Send commands to Event Trace Sessions directly without saving or scheduling.
The name of the Event Trace session to be stopped.

command:example.maml:title: -------- Example 1: Stop a WSMan Trace logging session --------
